ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Form used/assessment name
Notes: e.g., Self-Report, Parent Form, Short Form, Revised Version

ElementDescription: How did Texting 4 Relapse Prevention help you understand your illness better?
How do you think Texting 4 Relapse Prevention helped you keep track of your symptoms better?
How did the program affect your daily life?
What parts of the program did you find most interesting or fun?
What things can we change to make Texting 4 Relapse Prevention better in the future?
What parts of Texting 4 Relapse Prevention were confusing or hard to use?
What did you like best about Texting 4 Relapse Prevention?
What did you like the least about Texting 4 Relapse Prevention?
When, if ever, did you find it hard to read the messages?
When, if ever, was hard to reply to the messages?
As a provider, how did Texting 4 Relapse Prevention affect your clinical work?
Did your patients give you any feedback about the program that you think would be helpful for us to know?
What, if any, negative consequences did the intervention have for the patient?
How can we improve Texting 4 Relapse Prevention?
Lastly, if Texting 4 Relapse Prevention were rolled out in clinics in the area, how useful do you think it would be in improving clinical care?
P. I like the Texting 4 Relapse Prevention program. C. My patients liked the Texting 4 Relapse Prevention program.
P. The suggestions the program sent me to help with my symptoms were useful for me.

P. The text messages helped me notice when my symptoms were getting worse faster than I used to before I started the program; C. Texting 4 Relapse Prevention helped my patients better identify when their symptoms got worse earlier than they usually do.
P. Texting 4 Relapse Prevention made it easier to contact my provider when my symptoms got worse; C. The automated system made it easier for me to quickly follow-up with my patients if needed.
P. I found the text messages annoying.
P. The text messages were easy to understand; C. My patients were sometimes confused by the program messages.
P. The text messages that asked me to reply were easy to answer.
P. The text messages were positive and helped me feel supported; C. The intervention helped my patients feel supported.
P. Texting 4 Relapse Prevention got in the way of my daily activities.
P. Texting 4 Relapse Prevention sent me too many text messages every day.
P. If Texting for Relapse Prevention was offered again, I would sign up for it.

P. I would recommend the Texting 4 Relapse Prevention program to other patients who have a similar illness as I do; C. I would recommend Texting 4 Relapse Prevention to other clinicians who have patients with schizophrenia or SAD.
C. As a clinician, I liked the Texting 4 Relapse Prevention program.
C. I would be unlikely to use this intervention with my patients if it were made available in my clinic.
C. The automated system made it easier for me to monitor my patients.
C. The intervention helped my patients better monitor their own symptoms of schizophrenia or schizoaffective disorder.
C. The program didn't really help my patient's improve their coping skills related to symptom management.
Acceptability score
(Patient estimate) How many messages did you receive from the Texting 4 Relapse Prevention program yesterday?
(Patient estimate) How many messages did you send to the program yesterday?
(Patient estimate) How many messages did you receive from the program in the last 7 days? Your best guess is fine.
(Patient estimate) How many messages did you send to the program in the last 7 days? Your best guess is fine.
(Patient estimate) In general, how often did you read the program messages in the past 7 days?
Notes: 1=Never (0 messages in the past week); 2=Rarely (1-5 messages); 3=Sometimes (6-14 messages); 4=Often (15 - 27messages); 5=always (28 messages)
